unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26, 2023 – India's ambitious smart meter deployment program is gaining traction, with significant progress reported in several states. The initiative aims to replace conventional electricity meters with smart meters, enabling real-time data collection and improved grid management.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six, two thousand and twenty three – India's ambitious smart meter deployment program is gaining traction, with significant progress reported in several states. The initiative aims to replace conventional electricity meters with smart meters, enabling real-time data collection and improved grid management.

unnormalised: Power Grid Corporation of India Limited (PGCIL) is playing a key role in facilitating this transition, providing technical expertise and support to various distribution companies (DISCOMs). As of 17/10/2023, over 5 million smart meters have been installed nationwide, contributing to reduced Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses.
normalised: Power Grid Corporation of India Limited (P G C I L) is playing a key role in facilitating this transition, providing technical expertise and support to various distribution companies (D I S C O Ms). As of seventeenth October two thousand and twenty three, over five million smart meters have been installed nationwide, contributing to reduced Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses.

unnormalised: Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd (MSEDCL) announced plans to install an additional 2 million smart meters by December 31, 2024, focusing on urban and semi-urban areas. The project is expected to cost Rs. 8,000 crore.
normalised: Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution C o. L t d (M S E D C L) announced plans to install an additional two million smart meters by December thirty one, two thousand and twenty four, focusing on urban and semi-urban areas. The project is expected to cost rupees eight thousand crore.

unnormalised: Consumers will benefit from enhanced billing accuracy and the ability to monitor their energy consumption patterns via a dedicated mobile application, scheduled for launch at 11:00 hrs on November 14, 2023, marking Children’s Day. Early data suggests a potential reduction in average household electricity bills by 10-15% in pilot project areas like Chandigarh. This initiative aligns with the Government of India's vision of "Power for All" and sustainable energy practices. The next review meeting is scheduled for 09:30 hrs, November 2, 2023.
normalised: Consumers will benefit from enhanced billing accuracy and the ability to monitor their energy consumption patterns via a dedicated mobile application, scheduled for launch at eleven zero zero hours on November fourteen, two thousand and twenty three, marking Children’s Day. Early data suggests a potential reduction in average household electricity bills by ten to fifteen percent in pilot project areas like Chandigarh. This initiative aligns with the Government of India's vision of "Power for All" and sustainable energy practices. The next review meeting is scheduled for nine thirty hours, November two, two thousand and twenty three.
